result.execSummary:
The defendant John R. Sammer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  

No contact with M.L.K.Z and J.C.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

SAFE program intake, assessment and completion.  

AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample.  

60/90/120 probation review hearings.  

Probation agent to assist defendant with retrieval of personal belongings from house.

timeConds.notes:
120 days MCJ; STAY 60 days for rules violations, SERVE 60 days.
Concurrent with: Count 3.

40 hours community service I/S to be used for rules violations.
Concurrent with: Count 3.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 1:17 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears by video with Atty Heather Roehr in person. 
DOC Agent, Brittney Ahles-Zuehlke appears by video. 

Date and time set for probation review hearing. 
COURT questions defendant re: probation status.  
Defendant makes statement.  

COURT sets probation review hearing for 12/16/22 at 1:15 p.m. 

Adj:  1:19 p.m.
PROBATION STATUS REVIEW REPORT
Probation review hearing on September 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
to Amend JOC
Winnebago County Sheriff's Office
Re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
Letters from DCC Records staff to Court requesting review of Ct.2
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Amended Information
Probation review hearing on August 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 10:01 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry. 
Defendant appears in person/in custody with Atty Katherine Drury and Atty Heather Roehr in person. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing; VRCW. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

State moves to DRI Count 1 (Strangulation and Suffocation/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA) and Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater); COURT GRANTS.

State moves to AMEND Count 2 (Battery/DA Repeater/Reepater/DA) to FELONY Disorderly Conduct/DA Repeater/Repeater/Domestic Abuse under 947.01; COURT GRANTS.  State will file Amended Information.  

PLEA>>
Count 2 (Disorderly Conduct/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA):  NO CONTEST.  
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater):  NO CONTEST.  

COURT ORDERS on Count 2: SWH for 2 years probation; concurrent with Count 3. 
COURT ORDERS on Count 3: SWH for 3 years probation. 

CONDITIONS on each count:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  SAFE program intake, assessment and completion.  AODA and follow up.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No contact with M.L.K.Z and J.C.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  Domestic Abuse surcharge.  40 hours community service I/S to be used for rules violations.  120 days MCJ; STAY 60 days for rules violations, SERVE 60 days.  COURT grants 63 days credit to be applied toward imposed jail time.  60/90/120 probation review hearings.  COURT authorizes probation agent in assisting defendant with retrieval of personal belongings from house. 

Probation review hearing>>>8/05/22 at 1:15 p.m.
Defendant states he might be incarcerated at Winnebago County Jail at that time. 

Adj:  10:30 a.m.

Re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
Motion hearing on May 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  3:12 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry. 
Defendant appears by video from Winnebago Co Jail with Atty Katherine Drury for ADA Heather Roehr in person. 

Date and time set for Daubert motion hearing; VRCW. 
COURT recites history; parties are ready to proceed. 
Atty Drury states she discussed with defendant re: personal appearance today; defendant waives right to personally appear. 
COURT advises that an evidentary hearing cannot proceed as there is no video on witness stand; 
Atty McGarry makes statement re: discovery and proceeding today. 
COURT cannot find compliance with statute re: video appearance for evidentiary hearing and advises parties to reset Daubert hearing immediately after Court today.

COURT addresses additional motions that need to be heard.
Atty McGarry addresses States other acts motion (Doc 41) and defendant's response (Doc 48); parties make additional arguments. 
COURT makes findings and does not allow first Act, but will allow second Act. 

COURT addresses Defendant's MIL (Doc 39); 
Atty McGarry makes statement;  COURT makes findings; #1 granted. #2 granted. #3 granted to sequestration, but gives defense opportunity to supplement on due process rights.  #4 granted.  #5 granted. #6 withholding on ruling. #7- #11 granted. #12 granted subject to State identifying witness. #13 granted. #14 granted.  

COURT advises States MIL will be heard at Daubert hearing.  Atty Drury is in agreement so they have time to review. 

Adj:  3:46 p.m.

ADA McGarry states offer deadline was today and relayed to counsel. 
Atty Roehr states offer has been rejected.  
COURT makes statement to deft re: final offer.  Defendant makes statement and understands. 

COURT directs parties to set hearing with Judicial Assistant.
